title: Jean Deysel
text:
Jean Roy Deysel (born 5 March 1985 in <a href="Virginia%2C%20Free%20State">Virginia, Free State</a>, <a href="South%20Africa">South Africa</a>) is a former professional <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> player who most recently played for <a href="Ulster%20Rugby">Ulster</a> in the <a href="Pro14">Pro14</a>.
Deysel signed a two-year contract to join <a href="Japan">Japan</a>ese side <a href="Toyota%20Verblitz">Toyota Verblitz</a> at the conclusion of the <a href="2014%20Super%20Rugby%20season">2014 Super Rugby season</a>. On 16 March 2017, it was announced that Deysel had joined Irish <a href="Pro14">Pro12</a> side <a href="Munster%20Rugby">Munster</a> on a three-month loan as injury cover for his compatriot <a href="Jean%20Kleyn">Jean Kleyn</a>. On 8 April 2017, Deysel made his debut for Munster when he started against Scottish side <a href="Glasgow%20Warriors">Glasgow Warriors</a> in a <a href="2016%E2%80%9317%20Pro12">2016–17 Pro12</a> fixture. Munster won 10–7, with Deysel being replaced by <a href="Peter%20O%27Mahony">Peter O'Mahony</a> in the 42nd minute. On 22 April 2017, Deysel made his European debut when he replaced <a href="Tommy%20O%27Donnell">Tommy O'Donnell</a> in Munster's <a href="2016%E2%80%9317%20European%20Rugby%20Champions%20Cup">2016–17</a> semi-final defeat at the hands of defending champions <a href="Saracens%20F.C.">Saracens</a> in the <a href="Aviva%20Stadium">Aviva Stadium</a>, <a href="Dublin">Dublin</a>. On 27 May 2017, Deysel made his final appearance for Munster when he came off the bench against <a href="Scarlets">Scarlets</a> in the <a href="2017%20Pro12%20Grand%20Final">2017 Pro12 Grand Final</a>. Following the completion of his loan spell at Munster, Deysel was granted an early release from his Sharks contract and signed a two-year deal with another Irish province, this time moving to <a href="Ulster%20Rugby">Ulster</a>. Ulster announced on 24 October 2018, Deysel would retire from professional rugby with immediate effect.
